intro: Atitara setosa, commonly known as the hairy nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of violet or purple flowers. Its fruit is a small, toxic berry that contains alkaloids. Due to its toxic properties, it is often avoided in cultivation and requires caution when handled.
